title: AFK leave buster evading
body:
How and why is this even a thing that can still work in this day and age of League? If Cho Gath doesn't do 1 point of damage to a minion, monster or champion from minute 6 to minute 17, but inputs commands to dance while in the fountain and laugh while in the fountain and moves slightly in the fountain... guess what? He's afking and taking the slight time to evade leave buster.

Riot can surely recognize said Cho is contributing nothing based on raw data from minute 6 to minute 17, but had time to input dance and laugh spams. In said scenario, they can surely immediately, automatedly give Cho'Gath the next elevation in his punishment towards perma ban. Safely as well, it's uncontestable in these types of scenarios.

Step it up RITO.

replies.body: They do detect this and if the guy does it often enough he will get some kind of punishment.

Actually, Leaverbuster is capable of detecting and punishing certain behaviors even if the player doesn't physically disconnect from the match, and the behavior described in the OP is on of them. If you run around in base doing absolutely nothing useful, you may evade being automatically kicked from the game, but you won't evade Leaverbuster itself. Now, they may not necessarily be punished by Leaverbuster after that particular game since the system does have some leniency to it, but if they continue running around in base in future games, then they will indeed get a punishment.
riot only cares about riven mains feelings insult one of them u get banned

The AFK leave buster is the worst designed system in any game I have ever played. I got 5 20 minute qs as a penalty for not being able to connect to the game for 3 in a row and guess what due to the new rule if you don't play for the first 3 minutes it washes game and wastes everyone time. Those games I could've easily gotten back into after a few minutes by resetting router/computer/ checking network ect. The days of playing 4v5s is also long gone you will no longer ever get to play them. Today I was sitting in q for the 20 minutes accept it go through champs and I forget to lock in and guess what? game drops puts me and my friend in a 6 minute wait time so the que went from 22min to 28min then after that another 20 minute wait til to get into another game. It is just ridiculous and beyond me that this system is suppose to punish people who intentionally afk or troll yet it only punishes people with computer and connection issues. I will no longer support riot by buying a single skin, champion, or piece of merchandise. The company has gone from a fun community driven game to a money hungry automated system that does nothing but take away from the game.

My favorite is putting a pink ward in the golums, standing on the other side of the wall, and autoattacking it. The camp resets before it even gets to you to do damage and you'll never kill the camp either.

So many players I've reported for doing this. I have yet to see 1 single player punished for it (yes I have their names on op.gg and occasionally check to see if their still playing or got banned).
how would this work if jg clears the gromp?

I make it a point to clear the entire jg if I get one of them in my group. But, the jg spawns long before it will kick the player for being afk. So they can just check back in and either move camps and auto attack the newly spawned camp once and start it over.

Riot doesnt care about players and if their happy playing the game.  they care about money and if theyre making enough to support the other things that bring money to them.  They do not care about us.

Oh stop with this kind of BS. If people aren't happy with the game they take their wallet elsewhere, it's in Riot's best interest to keep their customers happy so they stay and buy stuff. If you walk into a store and the employees are constantly pelting you with rocks you're never going shopping there again, are you?
Now I was with you for the first part, but don't you DARE insult my store!
To be fair the guy wasn't AFK. He was quite obviously trolling.
